distribution_native_art_desc: Acanthocalyx nepalensis subsp. delavayi is primarily native to the eastern Himalayas, including regions in Nepal, Bhutan, and northern India. It thrives in moist, temperate forests at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. This subspecies is commonly found in areas with well-drained soils and partial to full shade. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species. Due to its restricted distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic plant in these regions.
